Title: Congo president turned down predecessor's PM pick -sources
Content: KINSHASA/BRUSSELS (Reuters) - Former Congolese President Joseph Kabila wanted his successor, Felix Tshisekedi, to appoint Albert Yuma, a Kabila ally and chairman of state mining company Gecamines, as prime minister, but Tshisekedi refused, sources familiar with the matter said.

Title: Tripoli hospitals report 47 dead in recent fighting - U.N
Content: TRIPOLI/GENEVA (Reuters) - Health facilities near Tripoli have reported 47 people killed and 181 wounded in recent days as eastern forces seek to take Libya's capital from an internationally-recognised government, the United Nations' health body said on Tuesday.

Title: Algeria's parliament appoints Abdelkader Bensalah as interim president - witness
Content: ALGIERS (Reuters) - Algeria's parliament appointed on Tuesday the upper house chairman Abdelkader Bensalah as interim president for the next 90 days following the resignation of Abdelaziz Bouteflika, a Reuters withness said.

Title: Battle rages for Libya's capital, airport bombed
Content: TRIPOLI/BENGHAZI, Libya (Reuters) - A warplane attacked Tripoli's only functioning airport on Monday as eastern forces advancing on the Libyan capital disregarded international appeals for a truce in the latest of a cycle of warfare since Muammar Gaddafi's fall in 2011.

Title: U.S. tourist, guide kidnapped in Uganda freed after 'settlement' -tour firm
Content: KAMPALA (Reuters) - An American tourist and her guide who were abducted in Uganda last week were released after a "negotiated settlement" was reached with the kidnappers, the firm that organised her safari told Reuters on Monday.

Title: Sudanese army blocks attempt to disperse protesters -witnesses
Content: KHARTOUM (Reuters) - Sudanese soldiers intervened to protect several thousand demonstrators calling for an end to President Omar al-Bashir's rule on Monday after security forces tried to break up the sit-in, witnesses and activists said.

Title: Cyclone Idai's death toll stands at 847, cholera cases rise
Content: BEIRA, Mozambique (Reuters) - Hundreds of thousands of people are in need of food, water and shelter after Cyclone Idai battered Mozambique, Zimbabwe and Malawi.

Title: Seven people killed over two days during protests in Sudan - interior minister
Content: KHARTOUM (Reuters) - Six people were killed in the Sudanese capital Khartoum during protests on Saturday and Sunday and one more died in the western region of Darfur, the interior minister told parliament.

Title: Libyan death toll rises as battle for Tripoli intensifies
Content: TRIPOLI/BENGHAZI, Libya (Reuters) - Eastern Libyan forces sought to reach the centre of Tripoli on Monday after their easy advance through desert hit a trickier urban phase, with deaths and displacements mounting and the West aghast at the threat to its peace plan.

Title: S.African court says Mozambique ex-finance minister can be extradited to US -lawyer
Content: JOHANNESBURG (Reuters) - A South African court has ruled that Mozambique's former finance minister Manuel Chang can be extradited to the United States, where he is wanted on charges related to a $2 billion debt scandal, one of Chang's lawyers said on Monday.

Title: Coffee growers, future crops at risk amid low global prices -producers
Content: BOGOTA, March 27 (Reuters) - Global coffee growers are being forced into poverty by low international prices for the crop, farmers' representatives said at an international conference, warning the future of the industry is at risk.

Title: UPDATE 3-Soccer-Burundi qualify for first African Cup of Nations finals
Content: * Cameroon, Guinea Bissau and Namibia secure berths in finals

Title: Soccer-Burundi qualify for first African Cup of Nations finals
Content: JOHANNESBURG, March 23 (Reuters) - Burundi qualified for the African Cup of Nations finals for the first time as they kept Gabon striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang in check to get the point they needed in a 1-1 draw on Saturday.

Title: Central African Republic opens cabinet to more armed groups to bolster peace
Content: BANGUI, March 22 (Reuters) - Central African Republic has included more rebel officials in an expanded cabinet, the president announced on Friday, in a bid to shore up peace efforts after several armed groups said they were not sufficiently represented following a deal last month.

Title: CORRECTED-Vienna waltzes to quality of living win for 10th year
Content: VIENNA, March 13 (Reuters) - The Austrian capital Vienna has topped Mercer's index of most liveable cities for the 10th year in a row.

Title: Ex-Congolese VP seeks damages from war crimes court
Content: THE HAGUE, March 11 (Reuters) - Former Congolese vice president and militia leader Jean-Pierre Bemba, who was acquitted of war crimes by the International Criminal Court (ICC) last year, is seeking nearly 70 million euros ($75 million dollars) in damages.

Title: Central African Republic peace deal faces setback
Content: BANGUI, March 5 (Reuters) - Central African Republic's month-old peace deal with armed groups is facing its first major challenge this week, after several signatories said a newly-formed government was not sufficiently representative.

Title: Congo Ebola centre in flames after another armed attack
Content: GOMA, Democratic Republic of Congo, Feb 27 (Reuters) - Armed assailants attacked an Ebola centre in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo on Wednesday, setting off a fire and becoming embroiled in an extended gunbattle with security forces that has yet to end, the local mayer said.

Title: HIGHLIGHTS-Russian President Putin's address to parliament
Content: MOSCOW, Feb 20 (Reuters) - The following are highlights from Russian President Vladimir Putin's annual address to parliament on Wednesday. RUSSIA-USA RELATIONS "We have no interest in confrontation and we don't want one, least of all with such a global power as the United States. But it appears our partners haven't noticed how quickly the world is changing, and where it is heading. They continue their destructive and plainly mistaken policy."

Title: Knock-on effects of war kill 300 babies every day - charity
Content: LONDON, Feb 15 (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - Starvation, disease and a lack of aid are killing 300 babies a day in warzones around the world, with the number of children caught up in conflicts nearing a 30-year high, Save the Children said on Friday.

Title: UPDATE 1-Tripoli hospitals report 47 dead in recent fighting - U.N.
Content: TRIPOLI/GENEVA, April 9 (Reuters) - Health facilities near Tripoli have reported 47 people killed and 181 wounded in recent days as eastern forces seek to take Libya's capital from an internationally-recognised government, the United Nations' health body said on Tuesday.

Title: Tripoli hospitals report 47 dead in recent fighting - U.N.
Content: GENEVA, April 9 (Reuters) - Health facilities near Tripoli have reported 47 people killed and 181 wounded in recent days as eastern forces seek to take Libya's capital from an internationally-recognised government, the United Nations' health body said on Tuesday.

Title: UPDATE 4-Oil hits five-month high above $71 on Libyan supply threat
Content: * U.S. crude inventories seen higher in weekly reports (Updates prices, adds comments, previous dateline SINGAPORE)

Title: Libya's U.N.-backed leader receives phone call from Italy's Conte
Content: CAIRO April 9 (Reuters) - Libya's U.N.-backed prime minister in Tripoli, Fayez al-Serraj, received a telephone call from Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte late on Monday to discuss situation in Tripoli.

Title: Oil prices hit highest in 5 mths as Libya fighting tightens supply
Content: SINGAPORE, April 9 (Reuters) - Oil prices on Tuesday reached their highest since November as concerns over exports from war-torn Libya stoked tightness in the market, with global supply already hit by OPEC-led production cuts and U.S. sanctions on Iran and Venezuela.

Title: UPDATE 9-Oil gains up to 2% to five-month high as Libyan output threatened
Content: * U.S. Cushing stocks fell last week -traders, citing Genscape

Title: WRAPUP 4-Battle rages for Libya's capital, airport bombed
Content: TRIPOLI/BENGHAZI, Libya, April 8 (Reuters) - A warplane attacked Tripoli's only functioning airport on Monday as eastern forces advancing on the Libyan capital disregarded international appeals for a truce in the latest of a cycle of warfare since Muammar Gaddafi's fall in 2011.

Title: CORRECTED-Foreign interference in 2019 Canada election very likely -Ottawa
Content: OTTAWA, April 8 (Reuters) - It is very likely that foreign actors will try to meddle in Canada's October federal election, with the focus on political parties, voters and candidates, Canada's electronic signals spy agency said on Monday.

Title: Libya's U.N.-backed PM in Tripoli receives phone call from Macron
Content: CAIRO, April 8 (Reuters) - Libya's U.N.-backed Prime Minister in Tripoli Fayez al-Serraj received phone call from France's president, Emmanuel Macron, on Monday.

Title: Eastern Libyan force confirms air strike on Tripoli's only functioning airport
Content: BENGHAZI, Libya, April 8 (Reuters) - Eastern Libyan forces confirmed an air strike on Tripoli's only functioning airport, a spokesman said on Monday.

Title: MIDEAST STOCKS-Financials lift Dubai, most Gulf markets rise
Content: April 9 (Reuters) - Dubai's stock market rose for a ninth straight session on Tuesday as most of its financial shares rose, while other major Gulf markets inched up.

Title: Sudanese security forces in fresh attempt to clear protesters outside Defence Ministry -witnesses
Content: KHARTOUM, April 9 (Reuters) - Sudanese security forces, firing shots into the air, launched a new attempt on Tuesday to disperse anti-government protesters camping outside the defence ministry, witnesses said.

Title: INDICATORS-Egypt - April 9
Content: CAIRO, April 9 (Reuters) - INTEREST RATES Latest Last change Previous Central 15.75 14/02/19 16.75 bank o/n deposit Central 16.75 14/02/19 17.75 bank o/n lending Central 16.25 14/02/19 17.25 bank disco

Title: Trump, Egypt's Sisi to discuss security during White House visit
Content: WASHINGTON, April 8 (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump will discuss tensions in the Middle East, security, economic reform and human rights in Egypt during a meeting with Egypt's President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi at the White House on Tuesday, a senior administration official said.

Title: UAE's Finablr set to launch London IPO on Tuesday - sources
Content: ABU DHABI/DUBAI, April 8 (Reuters) - United Arab Emirates-based payments and foreign exchange company Finablr is set to launch its initial public offering in London on Tuesday in a deal that could raise about $500 million, three sources familiar with the matter said.

Title: Sudan's defence minister says security forces won't permit attempts to divide them - SUNA
Content: KHARTOUM, April 8 (Reuters) - Sudan's defence minister said on Monday that security forces would not permit attempts to divide them, according to comments carried by state news agency SUNA.

Title: Egypt’s strategic rice reserves at six months after latest purchase - ministry
Content: CAIRO, April 8 (Reuters) - Egypt’s supply ministry said on Monday it had six months of strategic rice reserves after its latest purchase.

Title: Seven people killed over two days during protests in Sudan - interior minister
Content: KHARTOUM, April 8 (Reuters) - Six people were killed in the Sudanese capital Khartoum during protests on Saturday and Sunday and one more died in the western region of Darfur, the interior minister told parliament.

Title: MIDEAST STOCKS-Dubai leads gains, most major Gulf markets rise
Content: * Dubai Investments enjoys best day in 4-months * Saudi's Enaya rises as accumulated losses shrink * ADNOC Distribution hits highest level since listing * Saudi's Tasnee gains after target price increase By Ateeq Shariff April 8 (Reuters) - Dubai's stock market rose for the eighth straight session on Monday and most major Gulf markets gained, as financial shares lifted the exchanges. The Dubai index rose 0.6 percent, as Dubai Islamic Bank added 1.6 percent and its la

Title: Egypt unveils 2,500-year-old mummy at forgotten cemetery
Content: MINYA, Egypt, April 8 (Reuters) - Egypt has unveiled the 2,500-year-old mummy of a high priest at an ancient cemetery south of Cairo.

Title: Malawi 2018/19 maize output up 24 pct, minimal effect from cyclone Idai- minister
Content: BLANTYRE, April 9 (Reuters) - Malawi's maize output increased by just over 24 percent in the 2018/19 farming year so far, boosted by favourable weather conditions and government subsidies, the agriculture minister said on Tuesday.

Title: UPDATE 1-S.African court says Mozambique ex-finance minister can be extradited to US -lawyer
Content: JOHANNESBURG, April 8 (Reuters) - A South African court has ruled that Mozambique's former finance minister Manuel Chang can be extradited to the United States, where he is wanted on charges related to a $2 billion debt scandal, one of Chang's lawyers said on Monday.

Title: S.African court says Mozambique ex-finance minister can be extradited to US -lawyer
Content: JOHANNESBURG, April 8 (Reuters) - A South African court has ruled that Mozambique's former finance minister Manuel Chang can be extradited to the United States, where he is wanted on charges related to a $2 billion debt scandal, one of Chang's lawyers said on Monday.

Title: U.N. ups Zimbabwe aid appeal after cyclone
Content: HARARE, April 5 (Reuters) - The United Nations asked donors on Friday for an extra $60 million to help Zimbabwe recover from a cyclone that tore through eastern regions last month.

Title: Swiss watchdog FINMA looking into Credit Suisse Mozambique case
Content: BERN, April 4 (Reuters) - Swiss financial market supervisor FINMA is accompanying British authorities in an investigation related to Mozambique and Credit Suisse, FINMA boss Mark Branson said on Thursday.

Title: UPDATE 1-Cholera vaccinations launched in post-cyclone Mozambique
Content: GENEVA, April 3 (Reuters) - Health officials launched a vaccination campaign in Mozambique's cyclone-hit port city of Beira on Wednesday in an effort to contain an outbreak of cholera that has already infected more than 1,400 people, the World Health Organization (WHO) said.

Title: Cholera vaccination campaign launched in post-cyclone Mozambique
Content: GENEVA, April 3 (Reuters) - Health officials launched a vaccination campaign in Mozambique's cyclone-hit port city of Beira on Wednesday in an effort to contain an outbreak of cholera that has already infected over 1,400 people, the World Health Organization (WHO) said.

Title: Hunger stalks Mozambique after deadly cyclone destroys farmland
Content: NHAMPUEPUA, Mozambique, April 1 (Reuters) - Fulai Joaquim has enough food to feed his 10 children for another week, maybe two. Then, he says, it is in the hands of God.

Title: First cholera death recorded since cyclone hit Mozambique port, cases double
Content: MAPUTO, March 31 (Reuters) - The number of cholera cases has almost doubled in Mozambique in the past 24 hours and the port city of Beira has recorded its first death from the disease since a massive cyclone struck, health chiefs said on Sunday.

Title: Cholera cases increase to 271 in Mozambique's cyclone-hit Beira
Content: MAPUTO, March 30 (Reuters) - The number of confirmed cases of cholera in Mozambique's cyclone-hit port city of Beira has nearly doubled to 271 in the last 48 hours, the southern African nation's government said on Saturday.

Title: UPDATE 2-U.S. 2018 airstrike in Somalia killed 2 civilians, U.S. review finds
Content: WASHINGTON/NAIROBI, April 5 (Reuters) - The U.S. military said on Friday it had killed a woman and child in a 2018 airstrike in Somalia, the first time the military has acknowledged its strikes caused civilian casualties in the country.

Title: U.S. airstrike in Somalia killed two civilians in 2018, U.S. reviews finds
Content: NAIROBI, April 5 (Reuters) - A U.S. airstrike in Somalia killed two civilians in 2018, U.S. Africa Command said in a press release on Friday, adding that it believed it to be an "isolated occurrence".

Title: UPDATE 2-Car bomb explodes near police academy in Somali capital - police
Content: MOGADISHU, April 4 (Reuters) - Seven people were injured when a car bomb exploded near the police academy in the Somali capital Mogadishu on Thursday, police said, the latest in a string of attacks in the city by Islamist insurgent group al Shabaab.

Title: Car bomb explodes at restaurant near police academy in Somali capital - police
Content: MOGADISHU, April 4 (Reuters) - A car bomb exploded at a restaurant near the police academy in the Somali capital on Thursday evening, police said, the latest in a string of attacks in the city.

Title: UPDATE 1-Soccer-PSG reach French Cup final as Verratti nets rare goal
Content: * Cup holders have not conceded a goal in the competition (Adds details)

Title: Soccer-PSG reach French Cup final as Verratti nets rare goal
Content: PARIS, April 3 (Reuters) - Marco Verratti scored a rare goal for Paris St Germain as they beat Nantes 3-0 at home to reach the French Cup final on Wednesday.

Title: Kenya orders closure of Dadaab refugee camp this year, according to leaked UN document
Content: NAIROBI, March 29 (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - Kenya has ordered the closure of the Dadaab refugee camp by the middle of this year with the race now on to find homes for more than 210,000 people, according to a leaked internal United Nations document obtained by the Thomson Reuters Foundation.

Title: UPDATE 5-Al Shabaab car bomb outside Somali hotel kills at least 15 -medics
Content: MOGADISHU, March 28 (Reuters) - A car bomb exploded near a hotel and restaurants in Mogadishu on Thursday, killing at least 15 people in a busy area of the Somali capital previously targeted by Islamist militants, rescue services said.

Title: Huge explosion heard in Somali capital
Content: MOGADISHU, March 28 (Reuters) - A huge explosion was heard in the Somali capital on Wednesday, sending large clouds of smoke into the sky, a Reuters witness said. The cause was yet to be determined.

Title: RPT-Soccer-Kamara strikes late as Norway snatch 3-3 draw with Sweden
Content: OSLO, March 26 (Reuters) - Norway substitute Ola Kamara scored in the 96th minute to snatch a 3-3 draw at home to neighbours Sweden in a fiercely-contested Group F Euro 2020 qualifier on Tuesday.

Title: UPDATE 1-Congo registers record 15 new Ebola cases in one day
Content: GOMA, Democratic Republic of Congo, March 29 (Reuters) - D emocratic Republic of Congo on Friday recorded 15 new confirmed cases of Ebola, the biggest one-day rise since the current outbreak was declared last August, the health ministry said.

Title: Congo registers record 15 new Ebola cases in one day
Content: GOMA, Democratic Republic of Congo, March 29 (Reuters) - D emocratic Republic of Congo on Friday recorded 15 new confirmed cases of Ebola, the biggest one-day rise since the current outbreak was declared last August, the health ministry said.

Title: Congo Ebola epidemic exceeds 1,000 cases - health ministry
Content: DAKAR, March 25 (Reuters) - Congo's Ebola epidemic has now exceeded 1,000 cases, the Health Ministry said on Monday, with a death toll of 629 in the world's second worst ever outbreak.

Title: Soccer-Zimbabwe confirm death of fan before Cup of Nations qualifier
Content: HARARE, March 25 (Reuters) - The Zimbabwe Football Association have confirmed the death of a female fan in a stampede outside of the National Stadium in Harare ahead of Sunday's Africa Cup of Nations qualifier against Congo.

Title: Soccer-South Africa secure last berth at Cup of Nations finals
Content: JOHANNESBURG, March 24 (Reuters) - South Africa booked the last place at the African Cup of Nations finals with a 2-1 away win over Libya thanks to Percy Tau's double on Sunday to complete the lineup for the 24-team finals being hosted in Egypt in June.

Title: Congo Ebola outbreak spreads to city of Bunia
Content: GOMA, Democratic Republic of Congo, March 20 (Reuters) - H ealth authorities in Democratic Republic of Congo have confirmed a case of Ebola in another city of close to 1 million people, the health ministry said on Wednesday.

Title: Congo Republic cuts external debt on stronger economy, repayments
Content: BRAZZAVILE, March 18 (Reuters) - Congo Republic has slashed its external debt to 85 percent of GDP, compared with 120 percent just over a year ago, after its economy recovered from a slump and it managed to make some repayments, its monetary policy committee said on Monday.

Title: UPDATE 2-More than 500 Banunu killed in attacks by rival ethnic group in DR Congo -UN investigation
Content: GENEVA, March 12 (Reuters) - More than 500 men, women and children from the Democratic Republic of Congo's Banunu community were killed in attacks by Batende villagers in December, some beheaded and many slain as they tried to flee across a river, U.N. investigators said on Tuesday.

Title: UPDATE 1-Congo's Mai Mai militiamen attack Ebola treatment centre
Content: GOMA, Congo, March 9 (Reuters) - Mai Mai militiamen attacked an Ebola treatment centre at the heart of an outbreak of the disease in eastern Congo on Saturday, killing a policeman and wounding health workers before being repelled by security forces.

Title: RPT-Congo's Mai Mai militia attacks Ebola treatment centre
Content: GOMA, Congo, March 9 (Reuters) - Armed Mai Mai militiamen attacked an Ebola treatment centre at the heart of an outbreak of the disease in eastern Congo on Saturday, killing a policeman before being repelled by security forces, the local mayor said.

Title: Congo president turned down predecessor's PM pick -sources
Content: KINSHASA/BRUSSELS, April 8 (Reuters) - Former Congolese President Joseph Kabila wanted his successor, Felix Tshisekedi, to appoint Albert Yuma, a Kabila ally and chairman of state mining company Gecamines, as prime minister, but Tshisekedi refused, sources familiar with the matter said.
Country: Reuters: Dem. Rep. of Congo News

Title: Rwandan rebel group spokesman faces terrorism-related charges in Kigali court
Content: KIGALI, April 8 (Reuters) - A Rwandan court filed terrorism-related charges against the spokesman for the FDLR rebel group on Monday, two months after his deportation from neighbouring Democratic Republic of Congo.
Country: Reuters: Dem. Rep. of Congo News

Title: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-American tourist kidnapped in Ugandan park rescued
Content: KAMPALA, April 7 (Reuters) - An American tourist and her driver have been rescued unharmed after being kidnapped in a national park in southwestern Uganda last week, the Ugandan authorities said on Sunday.
Country: Reuters: Dem. Rep. of Congo News

Title: American tourist kidnapped in Ugandan park rescued -Uganda military
Content: KAMPALA, April 7 (Reuters) - An American tourist who was kidnapped alongside her driver in a national park in southwestern Uganda has been rescued unharmed, the Ugandan military told Reuters on Sunday.
Country: Reuters: Dem. Rep. of Congo News

Title: Democratic Republic of Congo plans oil licensing round this year
Content: BRUSSELS, April 5 (Reuters) - Democratic Republic of Congo plans to launch a licensing round this year for more than 20 onshore oil and gas blocks, the oil ministry said on Friday, its first since adopting a new hydrocarbons code in 2015.
Country: Reuters: Dem. Rep. of Congo News

Title: Belgium apologises for colonial-era abduction of mixed-race children
Content: BRUSSELS, April 4 (Reuters) - Belgium apologised on Thursday for kidnapping thousands of mixed-race children from Congo between 1959 and 1962, in a move to address the legacy of its often brutal 80 years of African colonisation.
Country: Reuters: Dem. Rep. of Congo News

Title: Congo arrests rebel leader wanted for mass rape
Content: KINSHASA, April 4 (Reuters) - A Congolese rebel leader accused of orchestrating mass rapes and other atrocities has been caught, Democratic Republic of Congo's army said on Thursday.
Country: Reuters: Dem. Rep. of Congo News

Title: EXPLAINER-How countries are getting tougher with mining companies
Content: LONDON, April 4 (Reuters) - A mix of political populism, higher commodity prices and the expectation electrification will spur demand for some raw materials has led resource-holding governments to change the rules for miners operating in their countries.
Country: Reuters: Dem. Rep. of Congo News

Title: REFILE-Two injured, two others missing after mudslide at Freeport's Grasberg mine
Content: * An incident at Freeport-McMoran's Grasberg mine in Indonesia injured two workers on Wednesday while two other missing, a company spokesman said on Thursday
Country: Reuters: Dem. Rep. of Congo News

Title: Pompeo pledges support for Congo's Tshisekedi 'change agenda' in first meeting
Content: WASHINGTON, April 3 (Reuters) - U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo expressed support for Congo President Felix Tshisekedi's "change agenda" to tackle corruption, improve human rights and strengthen security during their first meeting on Wednesday, the State Department said.
Country: Reuters: Dem. Rep. of Congo News
